messages.content: OK, ending...
This channel is not in combat.

> *With the final wraith going down and the whispers no longer, the party has a moment to catch their breath.  Wind begins to howl further down the corridor and you all look at each other with anticipation.*
> (What would you like to do?)

*Darias is a little shaky after the battle and the silence is loud. 

He takes a few breaths to calm himself as his very large form begins to withdraw and he returns to his normal tall state.*

“phew… ok. is everyone ok?”
*Aillig steps out and turns a critical eye onto his companions.* "Is anyone hurt badly?"

*Once everything was finally defeated, Quinn could finally suck in air, the cold biting her throat but better than being unable to catch her breath. She lowers her bow as Cala comes over, sniffing loudly over her. She can't help but smile,* "I'm okay, though I agree about those shrieks...they'll probably reappear in my nightmares. Any bits left in you?" *She hears Darias and Aillig ask about everyone.* "Cala and I are okay, are you both alright?"

*Ra'vek stumbles a bit as his adrenaline wears off.*

**"Arg... those things were so cold... I'm freezing straight to the bone."**
*He shivers his shoulders and rubs his hip vigorously where the last wraith slammed into him.*

**"I could probably use a moment before we continue."**
*Ra grabs his waterskin, looking around to assess if anyone else feels as shitty as him.*

*Walking over to Ra, Aillig pulls out one of the experimental sigils and pops open the seal. Holding it up in front of Ra's face, the sigil seems to swirl for a moment and then fades from the paper as some of the pain faids from Ra's hip.*

*Ra looks at Aillig with gratitude.*
**"Thank you, friend."**
*a bit dazed still, Darias realizes how injured they all were and casts healing magic on everyone*

messages.content:
*Ra turns to Darias*
**“And thank you as well, Darias.  I’m feeling much better!”**
Aillig McCaird: 57/67 (+12)

*A brief moment of warmth floods Quinn, feeling less battered after Darias' help. She gives him a curt nod in thanks, making sure her belongings are in order before walking towards the end of the hall.* "I can still follow where she's gone," *she tells the others,* "but not for long. We'd best get going to get as close to her as possible. Not that I'm eager to see her again but..." *She trails off, unsure of how to finish her statement.*
*Aillig nods.* "She needs being served a reckoning."

*Darias nods to his teammates at their thanks*

“We all need our strength in order to deal with the hag. I still have some magic left. 

I believe we should pursue it before it can cause more trouble.”
>>> *The quiet corridor ends in an archway of ice.  Ahead lies a narrower, dim path that curves out of sight through more glacial ice.  A cold breeze blows from within.*

*Quinn shifts her bag on her shoulders, checking that her bow and daggers are secured and at the ready. She glances back towards the troupe, counting heads, before she ventures forth into the path, stepping carefully across the cold ice. Her claws grip her boots as though to steady herself.*
*Darias takes a slow breath, a glint of fire in his eyes. He cast Blade Ward and pops his neck a few times. He follows Quinn closes with an eye out for danger*
*A fire sigil ready to be cracked open, Aillig advances with the others into the icy path.*

*Ra'vek sees the others gearing up and pulls out Nevermore and Nightpiercer, his trusty dagger and shortsword, and gives everyone a final determined look.*
**"Let's go!"**

*Ra turns with a swift pivot and strides down the icy path.*
*You all catch a glimpse of Kly pop into view as Ra charges into the dark.*

> *The party follows Ra'vek, staying close and quiet. The path curves down and heads deeper into the mountain glacier.*
> 
> *10... 20... 40... paces later it's getting darker and harder to see...*
> 
> *You continue cautiously forward, still moving downward and deeper.*
> 
> *And then... the darkness slowly begins to fades as a dim light brings back some visibility.*
> 
> *The glacial path end and opens into a vast cavern that steals your breath away. Not only is the cold bone-deep here, but the space is immense with an arched ceiling nearly 100 feet tall.  You have entered the hollow heart of a frozen mountain.*
> 
> ***You have entered the lair of Mother Snæbjörg!***
> 
> *You shake the chill off and take in your surroundings. The western and southern walls are visible as murky light fills the cavern from somewhere in the north.  Shades of grey cover every ice and snowy surface, but you cannot see the northern or eastern walls for what lies straight ahead blocks your vision.*
> 
> *No more than a stone’s throw away, a 20’ tall wall of snow and sleet swirls with an unnatural shape. It churns and churns… you cannot see through its dense depths.*
> 
> **(What would you like to do?)**

*Darias speaks softly*

“Pandora, can you fly a little higher and try to look beyond that storm”

*and Darias steps a little bit forward and then stops. He lets his vision fade and connects with Pandora to see through her eyes above the storm*
*Pandora flies up and peers over the cloud*

messages.content: > *Pandora rises above the swirling blizzard before you.  Darias focus this attention through Pandora's vision and can now better appreciate the full size of this immense cavern - it continues well behind Pandora's vision.  Daria's notices the storm moves below in a continuous, clockwise, vortex around a central point on the cavern floor.  Everything else is hard to make out in the dim light from this distance.*

“This place is huge, and the storm circles around a space over there”

*Darias says to the others pointing in the direction of the storm*

**Initiative 19 (round 1)**: Quinn (@Quinn | Lindsey)
```md
Quinn <60/67 HP> (AC 16)```

"That's comforting." *Quinn narrows her eyes, trying to follow the mark she placed earlier. The tug at her chest led her forward, but to where exactly, she couldn't tell. The dark light didn't clearly illuminate the hag's location. Usually there was an outline, a faint shimmering light to stand her out...but there was nothing. All she had was the pull, and a giant room before her.*

**Initiative 18 (round 1)**: Aillig McCaird (@Aillig McCaird | Aaron)
```md
Aillig McCaird <57/67 HP> (AC 22)```
*Aillig moves forward along the ice wall trying to see moreof the cave*
I'll hold a fire bolt

**Initiative 14 (round 1)**: Ra'vek (@Ra’vek | Aaron (DM))
```md
Ra'vek <51/83 HP> (AC 17) 
> Resistances: Poison, Fire```
> *Aillig is ever so faintly able to make out a far eastern wall as shadows dance in the dim light.*
*Ra sees Aillig slip off to the side and joins him while gesturing to Kly to head up over the storm.  Ra'vek then closes his eyes and makes a telepathic connection to see and hear what Kly finds.*
*You all see Kly fly up toward the edge of the storm before turning invisible.*

> *Like Darias, Ra’vek focuses this attention through his familiar’s vision. He sees Kly fly slightly above the edge of the storm and hover above the storm looking around as the storm rages below.  Kly is used to the dark and has no problem seeing in this dim light.  The full view of the cavern is laid bare.*
> *Subtle moonlight drifts into this icy, cold cavern from a large entrance off to the north.*

> *To Kly and Ra’vek’s surprise, the center of the lair has no storm. In its place there is a wide pillar of solid ice at the same elevated height as the storm’s apex. It’s not a natural formation, but instead something grown, twisted, carved…*
> 
> *Hovering above the platform, Kly’s eyes lock onto a **long crystal shard** hovering in wisps of frozen vapor. It glows from within, pulsing with deep blue luminescence.*

> *Tendrils of mist and frost spiral down from the shard in loops and coils as they connect to **four spheres** hovering around the edges of the platform. The spheres are translucent, crystalline, and concealing something within…*
> 
> *... something that **moves.***

> *And there!  **There she is!***
> 
> ***Snæbjörg’s** silhouette is at the center of the pillar, standing before the shard itself. Tendrils of frost and shadow coil around her like serpents.*
> 
> *She is entranced… unaware of the imp's invisible eyes watching her.*
> 
> *Kly hears something… not words, exactly. A hissing whisper. She’s calling out towards the shard... *
> 
> *Her voice rises louder and louder…arms raised, palms toward the shard… her body trembles with effort, frost gathering on her skin.*

> *A cold wind blows hard. The shard pulses. And the spheres glow brighter…*
> 
> *And then… **the closest sphere slams against the shard!***
> 
> *It doesn’t fall though… it shatters!  The fragments burst into a million pieces and then, dissolve into glowing mist.*
> 
> *Kly and Ra watch in wonder as the shard appears to inhale the mist with a deep, resonant pulse.*
> 
> *The shadow within lets out a single scream of anguish before its **shadow is consumed**… absorbed into the violet-blue glow of the crystal that grows brighter, hungrier.*

**"She's upon an ice pillar. Some... some sort of ritual..."**

>>> *Cala flies beyond the height of the storm, past huge crystals and glacial blocks of ice that line the walls, and into the mid-expanse of the lofty cavern.*

*From his new vantage point, Cala can see the same swirling vortex of the storm that several other’s noticed.  The central eye of the storm is still clear, but given the raised height of the churning snow and sleet, much of what lies within is hidden.*

*Cala’s years of experience have heightened his senses though and he locks onto a faint glow from deep within.  For just a moment, the storm thins near the center and Cala sees **the shard** pulsing in the center - an orb, or sphere, floats gently beyond…*

*And then… the storms shifts once again and the view is blocked.*
*Darias clicks his heals together and activates his wings boots. He doesn’t trust the storm, he doesn’t trust the ground, he doesn’t trust this damn hag*

messages.content:
*With a deep breath and his feet on the ground still he steps forward to enter the storm a bit. he might choose to backup but he will see what will be.*

“I’m going to touch the storm, we need to know more about it”
(pause)

> ***Darias:** you take a step into the storm and are instantly hit by the rushing blizzard.  It's frigid cold and you can barely see your hands in front of you. The wind rushes by and hums at a disturbing frequency.  You feel it in your teeth. In the back of your skull. It makes your vision swim slightly.*
> 
> *You shake your head back into focus... nothing else happens... you tell yourself, "It's just a terrible storm..."*

*Darias backs out not wanting to stay in there any more than he needed to!*

“Ah! Blast that is cold!! I don’t think it caused harm but i do not recommend going in there!!”

*After backing out he flies up 10’ and tries to scan for danger*

**Initiative 19 (round 2)**: Quinn (@Quinn | Lindsey)
```md
Quinn <60/67 HP> (AC 16)```

*After seeing her teammates struggle in the storm, Quinn skirts the edge of the room as she keeps her eye on the freezing cold chaos in the middle of the room. She pulls out her bow, cursing below her breath.*

**Initiative 18 (round 2)**: Aillig McCaird (@Aillig McCaird | Aaron)
```md
Aillig McCaird <57/67 HP> (AC 22)```

>>> ***Aillig:** You feel the cold intensify around you. A translucent form forms near your shoulder. It’s **Lorrien** from the mirror! Fractured and barely present, her edges flicker like candlelight in a wind.*

**"Aillig… you spoke my name. You pulled me out."**

*Her voice is thin, distant, layered with an echo of itself.*

**"But others are still trapped. Some are even there - I feel their anguish!"**

*She points up through the storm. Flickering in… and out.*

**"Others were hollowed out… destined for Thrumbolg's gates. Find them! Find her cold nursery... don't let anyone else…"**

*She struggles to hold form. And then… is gone…*

"Lorrien, the one that I freed from the mirror just appeared here, did you see her? Hear her?" *Aillig asks Ra. Then not waiting for an answer calls out to the others.* "The hag, she has more souls trapped here, we must free them before she can destroy them!
-# or do something ever worse..."
*And with that he turns and walks into the storm.*

>>> ***Aillig**: You take a step forward into the storm and the howling wind seems to come from everywhere at once. You take another step forward and stumble… catch your balance… and take another step.*

*You squint against the stinging ice crystals. This won’t be easy, but you’re determined.*

*You take another step… and another.*

 **WHOOSH!**

*A blast of wind hits again, knocking you back a step.  Your foot lands with a loud crunch of ice.  You look down…*

*…out of the corner of your eye, you swear **something moved.***

*Ra is still searching where Kly was lost in the Storm when he notices some whispering off to the side. He turns his head just in time to see a ghostly figure disappear and Aillig race off into the snow and sleet.*

**”Hey! Wait up!”**

*Ra’vek yells to the others.*

**“Aillig went in.  We must following!”**

*He races back towards where he thinks Aillig disappeared.*

**“Quickly, we need to follow Aillig over here!  Don’t stop until through the other side.”**

*Ra then looks towards the storm and pauses for a moment…*

**“Good. Kly is followig”**, he thinks to himself.*

*Ra’vek then grips his swords tightly and runs into the storm!*

*Kly hesitantly follows Ra in, as well.*

>>> ***Ra’vek**: you push through the blinding white, focusing entirely on staying upright, on moving forward. The wind screams. Snow batters your face. You can barely see… barely think…*

*… and then, beneath the howling storm, something changes.*

*You feel it more than hear it. A tremor through your boots. The snow beneath you shifts, almost like the ground is… breathing.*

**CRACK!**

*The earth EXPLODES upward!*

*Snow and frozen rock spray in all directions as **something massive** tears through the ground directly beneath you.*

*You’re launched into the air, weightless for a heartbeat, catching a flash of… scales? …teeth? …before gravity and chaos take over.*

**(Roll a Dex Save)**

**Initiative 7 (round 2)**: Calabaza De Peligro Ratto (@Cala | Emily)
```md
Calabaza De Peligro Ratto <47/59 HP> (AC 16)```
>>> *Meanwhile…*

> ***Cala**: Below you the wall of sleet and shadow churns alive with a winter’s rage.*
> 
> *You hesitate.  You know she’s there. **Snæbjörg.***
> 
> *For a heartbeat, you feel the cold memory of your frozen prison creeping in…*
> 
> *... trapped*
> 
> *... alone*
> 
> *... a cold, cold chill runs up your spine*
> 
> *Time stands still.*

> *... and then*
> 
> *... then a warmth stirs.*
> 
> *A heartbeat that is not your own. A warmth deep in his chest… slow and steady.*
> 
> *From above your head a gentle radiance grows - golden, soft, and alive. And from the light the shape of a woman floats down and hovers before you.*
> 
> *You know her. Eyes like dawn. Hair like sunlight. The warmth of mercy made flesh.*
> 
> ***Shrina the Compassionate One** stands before you once more!*
> 
> **"No flame is ever truly lost. In love, in sacrifice, in compassion - it endures."**
> 
> *Her gaze turns back toward the swirling maelstrom - towards Snæbjörg’s dark ritual.*
> 
> **"But hers is a flame long perverted. Lost to a world of cold and suffering. Should her ritual complete, she will unleash a storm that devours all warmth, all love, all life."**

> *The storm howls in answer, but Shrina’s light does not waver. She looks back at you.*
> 
> **"You have felt her cruelty. You have seen what becomes of those she touches. But remember! Through your friends, your fire has endured. Together you burned through the cold, the fear, the darkness. Let compassion bind your hearts once again."**
> 
> *She raises her hand and a pulse of molten gold surges forward and lands on your heart… enveloping you in warmth and love.*
> 
> *A moment later, tendrils of light arc outward as a dome of living radiance surrounds you. You are stronger than ever before.*
> 
> *The cold cannot bite. The winds cannot break. The darkness cannot divide.*
> 
> *Any fear that clung to you melts away, leaving only clarity and resolve - **Snæbjörg’s winter ends here!***
> 
> *You blink your eyes.*
> 
> *You realize you’re back down by your friends. Hovering just steps away from them.*
> 
> *What just happened.*
> 
> *Was it a dream?*
> 
> *And then … gently.. You hear her voice whisper in your head… softer now but still resolute:*
> 
> **"Go now, my child of the Eternal Flame. Let your warmth surround your friends and strike down the heart of this winter!"**
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1308102594035580938/1436632676080812103/cala-heart.png?ex=6911a171&is=69104ff1&hm=f983f77691050279a4464aa2b27d81f938ef17da7e37f79e5dab3be37ad26804&

> ***Everyone Else:** Out of the corner of your eye you see **Cala fall from the sky!***
> 
> *He’s unresponsive - eyes closed.*
> 
> *... dropping 10… 20… 50 feet!*
> 
> *And then… just 15 feet above the ground…*
> 
> *...he stops - suspended in midair, as if caught by invisible hands.*
> 
> *A glow begins to spread from Cala’s chest - faint at first, but it grows - pulsing in time with his heartbeat.*
> 
> ***Golden light spills outward 30 feet.**  Those close enough feel it - a pulse of warmth that beats not just in him, but in each of you.  The cold vanishes.*
> 
> *The blizzard nearby recoils and bends away Cala. Snow and sleet evaporate in trails of mist.*
> 
> *The light bursts and disappears. But the warmth remains.*
> 
> *With an audible gasp of air, Cala’s eyes blink open and he comes to.*

**Initiative 6 (round 2)**: MS1 (@Ra’vek | Aaron (DM))
```md

embeds.title: Darias of Stone and Fire uses Summon Wildfire Spirit!

fields.name: Effect
fields.value:
You can summon the primal spirit bound to your soul. As an action, you can expend one use of your Wild Shape feature to summon your wildfire spirit, rather than assuming a beast form.

The spirit appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. Each creature within 10 feet of the spirit (other than you) when it appears must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take 2d6 fire damage.

The spirit is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the Wildfire Spirit stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. You determine the spirit's appearance. Some spirits take the form of a humanoid figure made of gnarled branches covered in flame, while others look like beasts wreathed in fire.

fields.name: Effect
fields.value:
In combat, the spirit shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. The only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the spirit can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.

The spirit manifests for 1 hour, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to summon the spirit again, or until you die.

**Initiative 19 (round 5)**: Quinn (@Quinn | Lindsey)
```md
Quinn <43/67 HP> (AC 16)```
"Can anyone point the way towards the hag? I have a fireball that wants to meet her!"

> *Mother Snæbjörg is infuriated with the interruption of her ritual and has had enough!*
> 
> *She falls to one knee, breathing hard. She reaches toward the final sphere...*
> 
> *... and then back to Darias and the party with cold malice in her eyes.*
> 
> **"So be it!  The time as has come!"**
> 
> *Her voice cracks, mixing triumph and agony as she abandon's the final sphere and completes the last incantation of her ritual.*
> 
> *Her skin blurs between solid and mist.  She’s visibly… destabilizing…*
> 
> **(Legendary Action)**

> *A heartbeat passes.*
> 
> *Then the cavern trembles and the crystalline pillar shudders. You all stop and turn towards the center of the cavern as the storm begins to collapse inward.*
> 
> ***The Heart of Winter** pulses…and spins…*
> 
> *Faster… and faster…*
> 
> *The hag begins to float  from her ritual posture atop the pillar.*
> 
> *Higher... and higher...*
> 
> *Her form is completely unstable now. Barely holding together. The tether between a woman and something powerful… something primordial is nearly complete.*
> 
> ***"At laaaast!"** she rasps, her voice like wind screaming through a canyon.*  ***"At last, I am FREE!!!"***
> 
> *She spreads her arms.*
> 
> *The Heart continues to spin… and grow… faster… bigger… stronger…*
> 
> *The vast cavern is now completely visible as the storm and all of this cold energy has condensed back into the Heart.*
> 
> *You’re not sure what to do when…*
> 
> ***BOOM!!!*** 
> 
> *The Heart of Winter erupts outward with raw, primal frost energy in a beam that strikes Snæbjörg’s body.  Waves of violet and blue light surround her…  consume her…*

> *The pillar cracks down its center, fractures spreading like spiderwebs. In a few moments, it will collapse entirely.*
> 
> *The Heart is nearly empty now - just a hollowed-out shell of crystalline ice.  It pulses weakly one final time, then goes dark - drained and powerless.*
> 
> *The sphere Cala holds melts away and a shadow drifts up and way...*

> ***KRAAHHH-SHHRIEEEE-ROOOAAAHHHHH***
> 
> *A deafening sound fills the chamber - part cracking glacier, part scream, part howling wind - all converging into a single, earth-shaking cry that resonates through bone and stone alike.*
> 
> *And there - with the ritual complete - where Mother Snæbjörg once stood… something new is born.*
> 
> *A living blizzard - **The Ice Matron** - now hovers before you.*

> *A towering form nearly twenty feet tall, composed entirely of swirling snow, freezing wind, and malevolent cold looks vaguely humanoid, but is constantly shifting, dissolving, and reforming.  And the eyes - two twin points of violet light - burn with hunger as they lock upon your gaze.*
> 
> ***HUUUUURRRRROOOOWWWW***

**Initiative 18 (round 5)**: Aillig McCaird (@Aillig McCaird | Aaron)
```md
Aillig McCaird <57/67 HP> (AC 22) 
* Flaming Sphere [8 rounds]  <C>
* Ball of Fire [8 rounds] (Attack: Flaming Sphere; Parent: Flaming Sphere) 
 - Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw or take fire damage

*Just when she thought things couldn't get worse for herself, the hag in the distance transforms with an extraordinary screech, piercing deep into her marrow as jaws clamp onto her. Pain sears through her once more ands he struggles to free herself to no avail. In one mere snap, she could lose her life. Her gaze darts all around in panic, before her eyes set on distant, solid ground. A whisper later, she stands far from the beast, catching her breath for only a moment before she bolts further away, pulling out her bow and aiming at the creature. But when she can fully see the being in the center of the room, high atop the ice, she can feel the cold freeze her very soul. With shivering fingers, she raises the bow and fires two well-aimed arrows, hoping she can keep her distance.*
>>> *Both arrows land in the Ice Matron like little magically enhanced pin pricks. You’ve gain its attention.*

>>> ***Aillig:** you feel the brush of death and your hair stands on end. Lorrien fades in and she speaks again, there's an edge of terror beneath the fading voice.*

**"I cannot stay…"**

*Lorrien’s form is already beginning to dissolve.*

**"Harken! My wand is yours now. Speak the word: ||Fyr'eth||. Punish the corrupted one!"**

*Lorrien points up the tempestad above… and then breaks off...*

*She is gone, but the wand grows warm by your side. You know how to weld it.*

>>> *A rush of wind is sucked upward towards the Ice Matron as it stares down at Quinn and then the others. It nearly pulls the breath right out of you.*

*And then a blast of freezing cold forms around the flying creature. What little moisture was left in the air forms light snowflakes around the creature, giving a hint of its aura.*

**(Legendary Action)**
>>> *Darias is close enough to feel the temperature drop immediately. Is colder than anything he’s ever experienced.*

embeds.title: Darias of Stone and Fire uses Summon Wildfire Spirit!

fields.name: Effect
fields.value:
You can summon the primal spirit bound to your soul. As an action, you can expend one use of your Wild Shape feature to summon your wildfire spirit, rather than assuming a beast form.

The spirit appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. Each creature within 10 feet of the spirit (other than you) when it appears must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take 2d6 fire damage.

The spirit is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the Wildfire Spirit stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. You determine the spirit's appearance. Some spirits take the form of a humanoid figure made of gnarled branches covered in flame, while others look like beasts wreathed in fire.

fields.name: Effect
fields.value:
In combat, the spirit shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. The only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the spirit can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.

The spirit manifests for 1 hour, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to summon the spirit again, or until you die.

 - If you ram the sphere into a creature, they must make a save or take fire damage```

embeds.title: Aillig McCaird casts Enlarge/Reduce!

fields.name: Ra'vek
fields.value:
**CON Save**: 1d20 (9) + 3 = `12`; Failure!
**Effect**: Enlarged/Reduced [10 rounds] (Enlarge; Reduce; Parent: Enlarge/Reduce)

fields.name: Effect
fields.value:
You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the duration. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.

If the target is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.

fields.name: Effect
fields.value:
**Enlarge.** The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one category. If there isn't enough room for the target to double its size, the creature or object attains the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the spell ends, the target also has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also grow to match its new size. While these weapons are enlarged, the target's attacks with them deal 1d4 extra damage.

**Reduce.** The target's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one category. Until the spell ends, the target also has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also shrink to match its new size. While these weapons are reduced, the target's attacks with them deal 1d4 less damage (this can't reduce the damage below 1).

fields.name: Concentration
fields.value: Dropped Flaming Sphere due to concentration.

fields.name: Enlarged
fields.value: The enlarged target deals 1d4 extra damage with their enlarged weapons
